org.sm.smtools.swing.dialogs

Class JMessageDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sm.smtools.swing.dialogs.JMessageDialog

  • public final class JMessageDialog
extends java.lang.Object
    The JMessageDialog class pops up a standard dialog box containing a message.

    Note that this class cannot be instantiated, nor can it be subclassed; use the static show(java.awt.Component, java.lang.String) method instead. A valid I18NL10N database must be available!

    Depending on the application's current look-and-feel, the dialog box looks as follows:

      Java Metal L&F

      Microsoft Windows L&F

      Motif L&F

    Note that this class cannot be subclassed!

    Version:
    04/12/2012
    Author:
    Sven Maerivoet

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public static void show(java.awt.Component parentComponent,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Pops up a up a standard dialog box containing a specified message.

        This method should be called as follows:

          JMessageDialog.show(parent,message);

        Note that a valid I18NL10N database must be available!

        Parameters:
        parentComponent - the frame in which this dialog is to be displayed
        message - a string containing a specified message
